Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Stocky \Stock"y\, a. [From {Stock}.] 1. Short and thick; thick rather than tall or corpulent. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
Stocky, twisted, hunchback stems. --Mrs. H. H. Jackson. [1913 Webster]
2. Headstrong. [Prov. Eng.] --G. Eliot. [1913 Webster]

stocky adj : heavy and compact in form or stature; "a wrestler of compact build"; "he was tall and heavyset"; "stocky legs"; "a thick middle-aged man"; "a thickset young man" [syn: {compact}, {heavyset}, {thick}, {thickset}] [also: {stockiest}, {stockier}]
